oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter concerning the start of his second tour in Vietnam
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-page letter from Christopher Ammons concerning the start of his second tour in Vietnam. He describes his new unit, the 194th MP Company, which provides security for military installations. He mentions a visit by President Nixon to the hospital at Long Binh, and comments on how quiet it is on the base.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Nixon, Richard M. (Richard Milhous), 1913-1994; Long Bi`nh (Dong Nai, Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
